author: world today news
title: Anastasia Belous: Surrealist Exhibition Celebrating Imagination and War in Ukraine at Antoine Chevalier Gallery - World Today News
text:
The new exhibition ‚ÄúAnother Eye‚Äù presented at the Antoine Chevalier gallery in the West Village is a celebration of imagination, play of colors, lights, and the unexpected. Ukrainian artist Anastasia Belous, who currently lives in Spain after leaving her country in 2015 due to the war in Crimea, presents a series of works revealing her vision of surrealist painting ‚Äì the centenary of which is being celebrated this year. Witches on an airplane wing, women and children adopted by nature, giant rabbit, hairy chicken‚Ä¶ the scenes follow one another, like a joyful parade, on the walls of the new pop-up gallery by French gallery owner Antoine Chevalier.
Despite this apparent joy, Anastasia Belous‚Äô paintings are all about Ukraine and war. Since the new Russian invasion two years ago, the country has seen millions of people leave, mainly women and children, uprooted migrants on the roads far from their homes, without knowing what the future holds for them. It is this other view of the war, from the side of these exiles, that Anastasia Belous proposes to bring to this tragedy.
The exhibition opens this Thursday March 7 from 5pm to 8pm at 178 Bleecker Street . On display until March 30.
‚ÄúThe building fish, Anastasia Belous at the Antoine Chevalier gallery in New York . ¬© Gallery Antoine Chevalier
2024-03-07 17:37:40
#surrealism #Anastasia #Belous #Antoine #Chevalier #gallery #York #French #Morning

author: Rabbi Yissocher Frand
title: ‚ÄúShoot From Hip and Ask Questions Later‚Äù ‚Äì Is Not a Quality for a Jewish Leader
text:
Rav Frand| Level: Intermediate
These divrei Torah were adapted from the hashkafa portion of Rabbi Yissocher Frand‚Äôs Commuter Chavrusah Series on the weekly portion: ##1319 ‚Äì Honoring Your Parents Wishes After Their Death: How Far Must You Go? Good Shabbos!
On his deathbed, Yaakov gives brachos to his children. He begins with his firstborn son and tells him: ‚ÄúReuven, you are my firstborn‚Ä¶ Yeser s‚Äôais v‚Äôyeser az (greater by raising and greater by might).‚Äù (Bereshis 49:3).
What do the words ‚Äúyeser s‚Äôais v‚Äôyeser oz‚Äù mean? Rashi interprets, ‚ÄúYou were potentially fit to be greater than your brothers by having the kehunah, as indicated by the word s‚Äôais which is related to the expression ‚Äúnesias kapayim‚Äù (‚Äúlifting of the palms,‚Äù which takes place during Birkas Kohanim). Rashi also interprets the expression ‚Äúv‚Äôyeser oz‚Äù as implying that Reuven should have also had the leadership role in Klal Yisrael ‚Äì malchus (monarchy). Rashi infers this from the similar expression ‚Äúv‚Äôyiten oz l‚Äômalko‚Äù (Shmuel I 2:10).
What caused Reuven to lose this greatness, for which he had been destined? Yaakov continues his blessing to Reuven in the next pasuk: ‚ÄúPachaz k‚Äômayim al tosar olisa mishkivay ovicha‚Äù (Haste like water ‚Äì do not take more, because you mounted your father‚Äôs bed‚Ä¶) (Bereshis 49:4). Rashi interprets ‚ÄúPachaz k‚Äômayim‚Äù ‚Äì your impetuousness, which caused you to react impulsively when you felt your mother was slighted (in the incident in which Reuven shifted Yaakov‚Äôs bed from the tent of Rochel‚Äôs handmaiden to the tent of his mother, Leah, following the death of Rochel). The impulsiveness you demonstrated on that occasion disqualified you from being the king. Rashi says the expression ‚Äúpachaz k‚Äômayim‚Äù connotes fast flowing water that is in an apparent hurry to get to its destination. ‚ÄúYou are like a quick flowing stream ‚Äì too quick, too trigger-happy. Therefore, you are ineligible to receive all these extra benefits (kehuna and malchus), which you were destined to receive.‚Äù
On the other hand, by the bracha of Yehuda ‚Äì who does receive the monarchy ‚Äì the pasuk says: ‚ÄúA lion cub is Yehudah; from prey my son, you ascended (m‚Äôteref b‚Äônee alisa)‚Äù What does that mean? Rashi interprets: You, Yehuda, were part of the conspiracy to kill Yosef. You were the one who came up with the supposed story that Yosef was killed by a wild animal. You were part of all that. But what happened, Yehuda? You changed your mind. You withdrew and you said ‚ÄúWhat gain will there be if we kill our brother and cover up his blood? (Bereshis 37:26) You argued, let‚Äôs not kill him, but rather throw him into a pit. We can sell him to the Yishmaelim.
According to Rashi, Yaakov further noted that this is not the only time Yehuda changed his mind and regretted an earlier statement. He also initially issued a decree that Tamar should be executed (when he suspected her of being unfaithful and having illicit relations outside her family). But upon seeing her evidence to the contrary, he said ‚ÄúShe is more righteous than I.‚Äù (Bereshis 38:26)
What is Rashi teaching?
Rabbi Buxban from Florida wanted to explain these Rashis as follows: There is one quality that disqualifies a person from being a king or a leader in Klal Yisrael ‚Äì the quality of impetuousness and impulsiveness. Knee-jerk reactions are unacceptable for a Jewish leader. A leader needs to be able to think things through, and rethink things if necessary. Before carrying out a decision, a king must ask himself ‚ÄúIs this the right way to go?‚Äù
Reuven did not rethink his steps. He was offended. He stood up for his mother‚Äôs honor ‚Äì all well and good. But he didn‚Äôt say ‚ÄúHey, wait a minute! Let me think this thing through. What am I doing to my father? I am insulting him.‚Äù Because of that quality, Reuven could not be the melech.
Yehudah, on the other hand, also made mistakes. His initial reaction was ‚ÄúLet‚Äôs kill Yosef. Let‚Äôs kill Tamar.‚Äù But then he thought about the matter and said ‚Äúmah betza‚Äù (What is to be gained by this)? He changed his mind and retracted his position. He said, ‚ÄúMaybe I was not right.‚Äù That is an attribute needed to be a melech Yisrael.
‚ÄúShoot from the hip and ask questions later‚Äù is not the quality we want in a Jewish leader. And if a person cannot say the words ‚ÄúI was wrong. I made a mistake‚Äù he cannot be the melech.
Reuven ultimately did teshuva. In fact, the Medrash (Bereshis Rabbah 98) says that when Yaakov Avinu explains that Reuven did teshuva, he expresses it as follows: ‚ÄúYou have made yourself a mikvah of water and have purified yourself within it.‚Äù
Those who know a little about the laws of tahara (ritual purification) know that there are two kinds of bodies of water that can provide tahara to a person. The first is called a ‚Äúmikvah‚Äù which is an accumulation of rainwater. It must be completely still water, so still that if there is any leakage, it is not a mikvah anymore. It is called zochalim (flowing waters), which invalidate a mikvah. The other type of medium of purification is a ‚Äúma‚Äôayan,‚Äù which is a fast-flowing stream. If a person immerses in the Mississippi River, he has achieved the highest form of tahara. A ‚Äúma‚Äôayan‚Äù even purifies a Zav (a form of impurity which cannot achieve tahara by immersion in a standard ‚Äúmikvah‚Äú).
Yaakov emphasizes that the way Reuven repented was by immersion in a mikvah. As opposed to ‚Äúpachaz k‚Äômayim‚Ä¶‚Äù (as impetuous as a fast-flowing stream), which was the quality of Reuven that previously caused him to offend his father. Now he immersed in a stationary mikvah. The choice of that mode of tahara is symbolic. Reuven said to himself, ‚ÄúNo. Don‚Äôt rush. Sometimes we need still waters, like the waters of a mikvah, rather than the fast-flowing waters of a ma‚Äôayan.‚Äù
How the Doctor from Minnesota Won His Friday Night Bet With the Yerushalmi Yid
There is a custom throughout the Jewish world to bless our children on Friday nights. (Some people do this every Friday, and some people do it specifically on Erev Yom Kippur.) We bless our sons with the famous blessing (from this week‚Äôs parsha) ‚ÄúMay Elokim make you like Ephraim and Menashe.‚Äù (Bereshis 48:20) and we bless our daughters with the blessing ‚ÄúMay Elokim make you like Sora, Rivka, Rochel, and Leah.‚Äù
Over the years, we have said numerous peshatim on the meaning of the bracha ‚ÄúMay Elokim make you like Ephraim and Menashe.‚Äù Tonight, I would like to say over the following story which I heard recently:
There was a medical conference in Yerushalayim that brought together experts from all over the world on the topic of epilepsy. A doctor from Minnesota, who was a world-renowned expert in this field, came to the conference. He met there a Yerushalmi looking Jew who was participating in these meetings.
This was not the type of person who looked like a doctor (although today it is not always easy to tell). The doctor asked him, ‚ÄúNu, is your medical expertise in the field of epilepsy?‚Äù The Yerushalmi said, ‚ÄúNo. I am not a doctor at all, but I have a child who has epilepsy. Many times, I have travelled all over the world to conferences on this condition to hear what is new in the field. I want to know if there are any new medications or new treatments. Now there is an epilepsy conference in Yerushalayim, so certainly I came.‚Äù
The Yerushalmi then invited the doctor, the epilepsy expert, to his home for Shabbos dinner the Friday night after the conference concluded. The doctor accepted the invitation.
As the guest entered the house, the host told him (in private), ‚ÄúI have five daughters. One of them has epilepsy. I bet you won‚Äôt be able to tell which of the five has epilepsy. Her epilepsy is for the most part under control, and my daughter is perfectly normal. She is not self-conscious about her condition. I bet you won‚Äôt be able to tell which daughter has epilepsy.‚Äù
The doctor responded, ‚ÄúListen, I am a world class expert in epilepsy. I will be able to tell which daughter it is.‚Äù The host asked, ‚ÄúWould you like to bet on that?‚Äù The doctor said he did! (I don‚Äôt know what exactly they bet, but that is not important to the story.)
Throughout the entire meal, everything was fine. There were no outward manifestations of her illness at all. After the meal, the host (privately) asked the doctor, ‚ÄúSo tell me: Which is the one that has epilepsy?‚Äù
The doctor said (not in front of the daughters) ‚ÄúIt is that one!‚Äù The host was astonished. He said ‚ÄúYou are right! How did you possibly figure that out? She behaves exactly the same as all of her sisters! How did you know?‚Äù
The doctor explained: ‚ÄúDo you know how I knew? It was because when you benched your daughters before the meal, I saw that your heart rate increased when you benched her.‚Äù
When we sit at our Shabbos tables Friday night and we bench our children, in our minds we think ‚ÄúWhat do I want from this child? What do I want this child to be? What do I want this child to become?‚Äù As much as this father knew his daughter‚Äôs illness was under control, still, her condition affected his heart strings. It affected his heart rate. That is how the doctor knew.
The moment when we bless our children Friday night is really special. We have a unique ability to connect with each child, and then give each a bracha asking that they become like Ephraim and Menashe or like Sora, Rivka, Rochel and Leah. This is a most emotional moment. Perhaps the outer manifestations of these emotions are not visible to the average person. Perhaps this is not even something we are ourselves aware of ‚Äî but these subconscious expressions of bracha come from the deepest place in our heart.
Transcribed by David Twersky; Yerushalayim

Edited by Dovid Hoffman; Baltimore, MD

author: Theresa Hitchens
title: Space Force faces ‚Äòbellicose‚Äô PLA willing to risk escalation: RAND
text:
WASHINGTON ‚Äî A
new study by RAND finds that China‚Äôs military over the past decade has become more willing to use risky, provocative behavior in space to forward its political objectives, and less willing to communicate with the US Defense Department and the Space Force even during a crisis.
The report, ‚ÄúChina‚Äôs Growing Risk Tolerance in Space: People‚Äôs Liberation Army Perspectives and Escalation Dynamics‚Äù published June 24, is based on a review of recent ‚Äúauthoritative‚Äù open-source literature from ‚Äúacross the Chinese defense enterprise,‚Äù explain authors Howard Wang, Gregory Graff, and Alexis Dale-Huang.
‚ÄúThe findings suggest that the PLA‚Äôs thinking on escalation dynamics in space has become significantly more risk-tolerant than that found in PLA documents published just a decade prior. This shift emphasizes Xi Jinping‚Äôs guidance to be more proactive in shaping the international environment, which includes accepting higher but carefully calibrated levels of risk even though such proactive measures might result in unintended escalation with the United States,‚Äù the report summarizes.
Further, RAND warns that Chinese leaders have ‚Äúinflated threat perceptions of the United States‚Äù ‚Äî viewing US actions as aimed at maintaining global ‚Äúhegemony.‚Äù Thus, they tend to ‚Äúinterpret U.S.-led efforts to establish
crisis communication mechanisms or broader space norms as tools to control China‚Äôs behavior.‚Äù
Brian Weedon, a space policy analyst now at the Aerospace Corporation‚Äôs Center for Space Policy and Strategy, called the RAND report an ‚ÄúImportant new work on the security dilemma and escalation dynamics affecting space security‚Äù in
 a June 26 LinkedIn post.
The RAND report bluntly warns that the US likely will not have any ‚Äúdirect means for arresting unintended crisis escalation in space,‚Äù and will need to quickly make decisions about how ‚Äúto achieve a version of stability that Chinese leaders will tolerate‚Äù ‚Äî probably without ‚Äúcooperation with the PLA.‚Äù
The authors recommend that the US ‚Äúavoid investing costly efforts or making significant policy concessions to establish crisis communications mechanisms with the PLA. Given the CCP [Chinese Communist Party] history of aversion to crisis communications with the United States, PLA overtures to discuss such mechanisms might not be made in good faith.‚Äù
The report‚Äôs recommendations on communications is interesting given that
in recent months senior Space Force officials have said that their Chinese counterparts have been tentatively trying to break the ice with them on the issue of space safety. Further, in a June 10 speech, the State Department‚Äôs number two official, Kurt Campbell, said that he expects US efforts to restart frozen military-to-military talks with the PLA will soon show results ‚Äî noting that the State Department believes ‚ÄúChina is also invested in trying to head off potential areas of misunderstanding.‚Äù
The RAND authors also assert that given the ‚ÄúPLA‚Äôs push to proactively shape its strategic environment,‚Äù the US Space Force should expect to ‚Äúface a bellicose PLA eager to assert itself in space during peacetime.‚Äù Thus, the Space Force ‚Äúshould anticipate that PLA provocations in peacetime likely comprise a new normal in day-to-day space operations that involve China.‚Äù
However, the RAND authors stress that any PLA ‚Äúproactive steps‚Äù or risky behaviors ‚Äúremain subordinate to political decisionmaking,‚Äù so recommend that Space Force operators charged with figuring out how to react ‚Äúshould anticipate that the PLA is not likely to take proactive, escalatory steps in a crisis if those steps undermine its ability to prosecute such politically imperative missions as a war over Taiwan.‚Äù
Recommended
NGAD uncertainty won‚Äôt impact GCAP next-gen fighter effort in Europe, say analysts
‚ÄúWe are seeing estimates between $200-300 million per unit‚Äù for NGAD, said Douglas Barrie of IISS. ‚ÄúThe US is the only country in the world that could afford to do that.‚Äù

organizations.name: liberation army perspectives and escalation dynamics

author: Coin World
title: Iran Central Bank Limits Crypto Exchange Hours After $100 Million Nobitex Hack
text:
Iran Central Bank Limits Crypto Exchange Hours After $100 Million Nobitex Hack
The central bank of Iran has imposed strict operating hours on its domestic crypto exchanges following a significant exploit on Nobitex, a prominent Iranian crypto exchange. The hack, which occurred on Wednesday morning, resulted in the loss of at least $100 million in assets, including a range of cryptocurrencies such as Bitcoin, Ether, Dogecoin, XRP, and Solana. The pro-Israel hacker group Gonjeshke Darande claimed responsibility for the exploit, alleging that they infiltrated Nobitex‚Äôs internal systems and drained its hot wallets.
In response to the hack, the central bank of Iran has limited the operating hours of domestic crypto exchanges to between 10 am and 8 pm. This move is likely an attempt to stay on top of any further attacks, as incidents are easier to triage if they‚Äôre not happening in the middle of the night. Additionally, the Iranian regime may want to assert more control over their citizens‚Äô transactions, especially during times of high geopolitical tensions and potential capital flight from Iran.
Nobitex, which is a critical hub in Iran‚Äôs crypto ecosystem, has well over $11 billion in total inflows, compared to just under $7.5 billion for the next ten largest Iranian exchanges combined. The exchange serves as a central pillar of the country‚Äôs digital asset ecosystem, enabling access to global markets for users cut off from traditional finance. However, Nobitex also has links to a range of groups considered terrorists in the Western world, such as the Houthi rebels in Yemen, a pro-al-Qaeda propaganda channel, and sanctioned Russian crypto exchanges.
Following the hack, Nobitex severed all external access to its servers and stated that the situation is now under control. The exchange‚Äôs Reserve Fund will cover all assets lost in the hack, and the technical team is emptying the exchange‚Äôs online hot wallets and sending them to offline cold storage devices to prevent further exploits and losses. However, the internet disruptions and blocked access to external servers may result in a longer-than-usual timeline for restoring user access to the platform.
The hackers behind the Nobitex exploit burned the stolen crypto, making them permanently removed from circulation. This is achieved by sending them to an inaccessible wallet address. While hacks historically have almost always been for financial gain, this event stands out given the intent appears to have been politically motivated to take funds away from the regime. The attacker-controlled wallets were burner addresses lacking private key access, making them irretrievable.
This is not the first time that Iran‚Äôs central bank has imposed restrictions on exchanges. In December, it ordered a temporary shutdown of all crypto exchanges to prevent its national currency, Rials, from being exchanged and depreciating further. The recent hack and the subsequent curfew on crypto exchanges come at a time of heightened geopolitical tensions between Iran and Israel, with the two countries trading blows since Israel launched multiple strikes inside Iran on June 13.
topics: Economy, Business and Finance->market and exchange

author: Anonym
title: The Almeida government hires Senator Maroto's husband for a freely appointed position for which 23 candidates applied - The Limited Times
text:
The mayor of Madrid, Jos√© Luis Mart√≠nez-Almeida, has hired Jos√© Manuel Rodr√≠guez Carballo, husband of the first vice-president of the Senate, Javier Maroto (PP), in the City Council. Carballo, as EL PA√çS has learned, started working at the Cibeles palace in October. His position is that of deputy director general of Analysis and Evaluation, which reports to the delegate of Urban Planning and Environment, Borja Carabante, Almeida's right-hand man in the municipal organization chart. The salary of Rodr√≠guez Carballo, a career civil servant who has worked in the City Council of Durango (Bizkaia) for almost 10 years, is around 90,000 euros gross per year, as it is a specific position for category A public employees, belonging to Group 30 of the public administration. A total of 23 people opted for this freely appointed position, according to municipal sources. This newspaper has contacted Maroto by telephone, who has referred to the explanations given by the Madrid City Council.
A spokeswoman for the Consistory explains by telephone that a "public, free and transparent" call was opened for this position where "any official" who met the requirements to cover a level 30 could apply. "Carballo, a career civil servant and level 30 who has been consolidated for more than 15 years, applied for it," he says. "After studying the candidacies, after a report from the governing bodies to which the position of free designation is assigned and certifying all the services rendered, Carballo was elected to the post."
According to the information gathered by this newspaper, the Madrid City Council announced the position of Deputy Director General of Analysis and Evaluation in the area of Mobility and Urban Planning in the middle of summer, on August 4. The position was open to all career civil servants at level 30, but the position, according to the Consistory's work portal, was freely appointed. Therefore, the person in charge of the area decides who finally occupies the position based on their curriculum. In this case, the decision corresponded to the then general coordinator of Mobility, Federico Jim√©nez de Parga, a former deputy in the Assembly of Madrid and a strong man in the PP in Madrid. Jim√©nez de Parga resigned in October. The City Council, in response to questions from this newspaper, then replied that his departure was due to "personal reasons". Two months later, it became known that Jim√©nez de Parga had resigned from the position of general coordinator of Mobility because he had tested positive in a breathalyzer test on the streets of the capital.
The start of the application for the post of Deputy Director-General for Analysis and Evaluation began several days after the call, on 11 August, and ended on 1 September. According to the municipal file, anyone who applied for the position should have "experience in coordinating work teams, supervising or carrying out innovation projects, strategic planning and environmental sustainability and the 2030 Agenda". The text ended with a notice of the schedule that the person who wanted to apply for the position would face: "A more dedicated working day may be required." The place was finally awarded to Carballo, who was among the 23 candidates.
The award was published in the Madrid City Council Bulletin on the 22nd of the same month. All appointments by the Madrid City Council are published on the Transparency portal, as in this case. However, in Rodr√≠guez Carballo's profile, neither his salary nor his CV still appear, despite achieving the position in September. The calculation of the approximate gross 90,000 euros corresponds to the sum of the different amounts offered by the Madrid City Council for this type of civil servant.
Rodr√≠guez Carballo holds a degree in Economics and Business Administration from the Universidad Comercial de Deusto and is a career civil servant. According to his LinkedIn profile, he has worked as a manager at the Durango City Council (Bizkaia) from 2008 to 2017, 9 years and 10 months. Among other jobs, he has also worked as head of business with clients at the consulting firm Accenture (from 2020 to September 2023) and as deputy general manager of Local Recruitment and Training at the National Institute of Public Administration (between 2017 and 2019). Carballo married Javier Maroto, the current first vice president in the Senate, in 2015. The PP politician was also mayor of Vitoria between 2011 and 2015. Subsequently, he was deputy secretary general of his party under Mariano Rajoy. From 2019 to 2023 he also served as speaker in the lower house. Now, since August and after the changes of Alberto N√∫√±ez Feij√≥o, Maroto serves as first vice president in the Senate.
Javier Maroto has criticized political nepotism at different times in his career. In 2015, when he was deputy secretary of the PP, he criticized Manuela Carmena, then mayor of the capital. Carmena had appointed Luis Cueto, her nephew-in-law, as general coordinator of the Mayor's Office. "[Naming a relative] is not doing politics in any other way, but it's the worst thing about the caste," Maroto said. In November 2022 and, as stated on the website of the Popular Party, Maroto made another speech in the Senate where he criticised the government of Pedro S√°nchez and his advisers: "There has never been such a large government, not only because of the number of ministers, but also because of the number of advisers, collaborators and other staff, appointed with blatant family and partisan nepotism."

author: John Dillon
title: Twitter reacts to Mike Edwards‚Äô insane scoop-and-score touchdown
text:
The Kansas City Chiefs have an early lead against the Los Angeles Chargers in Week 18 after veteran defensive back Mike Edwards scored an unbelievable 97-yard touchdown after recovering a fumble in the first quarter.
Edwards‚Äô effort on the play was emblematic of Kansas City‚Äôs hard-nosed brand of defensive football this season and may prove to be the highlight that defines the Chiefs‚Äô performance in this game.
97 YARDS FOR THE SCORE!!! pic.twitter.com/VwPaAIS7ps
‚Äî Kansas City Chiefs (@Chiefs) January 7, 2024
While plenty of game remains to be played, and Kansas City‚Äôs victory on the road at SoFi Stadium isn‚Äôt guaranteed, Edwards‚Äô touchdown had social media channels buzzing on Sunday afternoon and isn‚Äôt likely to be forgotten any time soon.
Fans on Twitter reacted to his scoop-and-score in real-time and made their excitement about the play known after the Chiefs‚Äô disappointing showing on offense during the game‚Äôs first drive.
Check out some of the top tweets about Edwards‚Äô stellar play that gave Kansas City an early edge over the Chargers:
Felix got held, Omenihu great work punching it out, let‚Äôs go Edwards https://t.co/A9UvYRr6Sn
